subject: Productivity
title: Cue Routine Reward
description: A fast breakdown of Cue Routine Reward for builders.

hook.text: Every habit follows three steps: a cue starts it, a routine runs it, a reward locks it.

buildup.text: Charles Duhigg named this the habit loop. It explains why behaviors repeat on autopilot.

discovery.text: Your phone buzzes, you check it, you feel informed. That loop runs dozens of times daily.

twist.text: Willpower fails because it fights the routine. Changing the cue or reward works better.

climax.text: Once you see the loop, habits stop being mysterious. They become gears you can adjust.

punchline.text: Find the loop and you find the lever.

quiz.question: What are the three parts of the habit loop?
